_meta.title: Claims Policy Survey
_meta.description: Capture inputs for building a Claims Policy

questions.label: What facts about your business are provably true today?
questions.hint: Experience, credentials, ratings, published results - things you can back up with evidence
questions.placeholder:
e.g., 17 years Fortune 500 IT leadership
5-star Google Business Profile rating
Published case studies with client permission

questions.label: What credentials or certifications do you have?
questions.placeholder: e.g., AWS Solutions Architect, MBA, PMP, ISO 27001 familiarity

questions.label: What results have you delivered for past clients?
questions.hint: Specific outcomes with ranges (not point estimates). Only include work you personally delivered or supervised.
questions.placeholder:
e.g., Reduced support ticket volume by 40-60% for similar clients
Delivered chatbots handling 60-80% of Tier 1 inquiries
Clients typically see ROI within 6-12 months

questions.label: Do you have permission to share specific client case studies?

options.label: Yes, with client names
options.description: Can reference specific companies and results

options.label: Yes, anonymously
options.description: Can share results without naming clients

questions.label: What do you include in every engagement?
questions.placeholder:
e.g., Guardrails for hallucination mitigation
Role-based access controls
Post-launch iteration cycles
Documented data flows

questions.label: What security practices do you follow?
questions.hint: Data handling, access controls, compliance considerations
questions.placeholder:
e.g., Role-based access controls
Audit logging
Data minimization
Clear retention policies

questions.label: What absolute claims should you NEVER make?
questions.hint: Guarantees or promises that could backfire
questions.placeholder: e.g., no hallucinations, guaranteed ROI, zero data leaks, 100% uptime, never fails, always accurate

questions.label: What competitive claims should you avoid?
questions.hint: Comparisons that could be seen as unprofessional
questions.placeholder: e.g., we're the best, competitors can't..., unlike other agencies...

questions.label: How should you talk about accuracy/quality?
questions.hint: Safe ways to describe reliability without guarantees
questions.placeholder: e.g., enterprise-grade guardrails, human-in-the-loop escalation, validated against ground truth, continuous evaluation

questions.label: How should you talk about performance?
questions.placeholder: e.g., performance-first deployment, we validate page speed pre/post deployment, async loading with lazy initialization

questions.label: How should you talk about ROI/business impact?
questions.hint: Safe ways to describe value without guaranteeing results
questions.placeholder: e.g., clients typically recoup investment within X months, we measure deflection rate and customer satisfaction to quantify impact, your ROI depends on [factors]

questions.label: What KPIs do you propose tracking for clients?
questions.hint: Metrics you can measure and report on
questions.placeholder: e.g., deflection rate, time-to-answer, CSAT, booked calls, cost-per-resolution

questions.label: What industry benchmarks can you reference? (with sources)
questions.placeholder:
e.g., Gartner reports 40-60% deflection for mature chatbot deployments
Forrester estimates X% of support queries are repetitive

options.label: Balanced
options.description: Mix of confidence and appropriate humility

questions.label: What should the tone NEVER be?
